intro: Pabstiella lineolata, commonly known as the lineolate pabstiella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It is well adapted to drought conditions, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
